CAPTION FIG3.png: 'Figure 3: Example of low and high novelty/practicality inventions. The low and high novelty inventions are a “funnel” and a device that “slows elevators with centripetal force.”The low and high practicality inventions are an “unstable martini glass” and a “tool to catch water to measure the rain.”Note that the shapes used for invention are a cone, sphere, and tube.\n\n'
